result.execSummary:
The defendant Jammeell J Mckee Jr was found guilty of the following charge(s) in this case.

  • Vehicle Operator Flee/Elude Officer, a class I felony, Wisconsin Statutes 346.04(3).

Notice to employers: It may be a violation of state law to discriminate against a job applicant because of an arrest or conviction record. Generally speaking, an employer may refuse to hire an applicant on the basis of a conviction only if the circumstances of the conviction substantially relate to the particular job. For more information, see Wisconsin Statute 111.335 and the Department of Workforce Development's publication, Arrest and Conviction Records under the Law.

supervisions.descr: House of Correction - Imposed and Stayed

supervisions.notes: - Court ordered 6 months drivers license revocation.
- Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS.

miscConds.notes:
- Court sets restitution set at $0.
- Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by 08/10/22 by 5pm for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs. 
- Court waived non-mandatory court cost due to defendant's indigency. Court ordered defendant to pay mandatory court costs, surcharges. 
- As to costs, surcharges, defendant to pay while on probation. Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.

- Court advised defendant that as convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition. 
- Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

- no use of alcohol or drugs. 
- no possession of drugs without a valid prescription. 
- no new law violations rising to the level of probable cause.

- AODA assessment and any recommended treatments. 
- Absolute sobriety with random UA testing.
- Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

timeConds.notes: - Serve 60 days condition time in the House of Correction with Huber release for work and school. Report date is 8/19/2022 by 5 pm.

result.caption: State of Wisconsin vs. Jammeell J Mckee Jr

records.addlTxt: Clerical error: Added condition time report date and also the missing Expungement to the JOC.

records.descr: Request and Order to Correct Clerical Error in JOC

records.addlTxt:
Defendant Jammeell J Mckee Jr in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  Gerald Henry Alder appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  
State has complied with victim notification.  Sentencing hearing proceeded.  Statements made as to sentencing.   Additional statements from:  Cassandra M and Emily C.

AS TO COUNT 1: The Court sentenced the defendant to 12 months in the House of Correction with huber release for work and school.
The Court STAYED this sentence and placed the defendant on probation for a period of 3 YEARS.  

Court orders the following conditions of probation: 
 
- Serve 60 days condition time in the House of Correction with huber release for work and school
- AODA assessment and any recommended treatments
- Absolute sobriety with random UA testing
- Maintain work and school 
- 50 hours of community service
- no use of alcohol or drugs
- no posession of drugs without a valid prescription
- no new law violations rising to the level of probable cause 
- cooperate with PO agent return

Court ordered 6 months drivers license revocation
Court orders restitution set at $0
  
Defendant shall provide a DNA sample by 08/10/22 by 5pm for the Data Bank and pay all appropriate costs.
Court waived non- mandatory court cost due to defendant's indigency.  Court ordered defendant to pay mandatory court costs, surcharges.  
As to costs, surcharges, defendant to pay while on probation. Unpaid amount to convert to a civil judgment.  

Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm, body armor or ammunition.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended and he may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored. Court advised defendant of his right to seek post conviction relief.

Appeal rights given

Filed,
Sentencing Referral Form
*
  Court finds the defendant was under the age of 25 at the time of the offense, the charge is a Class H/I felony, society would not be harmed and the defendant would benefit by expungement.  Court grants expungement upon successful completion of the sentence.

Defendant Jammeell J Mckee Jr in court with attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Deputy court clerk cmt.
Defendant prepared to enter change of plea.  Hearing proceeded.  Negotiations set forth by the state.

As to Count 1: Defendant changes plea to GUILTY. Defendant examined as to his plea, advised of his Constitutional rights and the maximum penalty. Court found that defendant freely, voluntarily and intelligently waived his rights. Plea questionnaire received and filed. Parties stipulate to the complaint as a factual basis to sustain defendant's plea. Court found defendant guilty as charged and ordered a Judgment of Conviction be entered on the record. Defendant further advised that if he is not a US citizen deportation is possible. 


Court advised defendant that as a convicted felon he may never possess a firearm.  Court advised defendant that his voting rights are suspended, and may not vote in any election until his civil rights are restored.

Sentencing hearing adjourned, Branch 2.  Sentencing hearing scheduled for August 9, 2022 at 02:30 pm.

Defendant Jammeell J Mckee Jr in court with Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg.  James C Griffin appeared for the State of Wisconsin.
Case in court for scheduling conference.  The scheduling conference was held in person.  Defense has discovery and the state's offer requesting a plea and sentencing date.  The Court order the matter adjourned back to Branch 2 in person.  Plea/sentencing hearing scheduled for June 8, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Defendant Jammeell J Mckee Jr in court with Attorney Mark Stuart Tishberg; both appear in person.  Anna Marie Meulbroek appeared by video for the State of Wisconsin.  
Case set for a Preliminary Hearing. Parties are advised that this case is assigned to Branch 02, Judge Childs. Defendant waived Preliminary Hearing. Preliminary Hearing Questionnaire and Waiver received and filed. Court held colloquy with defendant. Probable cause has been found and the defendant is bound over for trial. Original Information e-filed, copy given to defense counsel who waived reading. Defense enters a plea of not guilty on behalf of the defendant. Case is adjourned to Br. 02.  Scheduling conference scheduled for April 27, 2022 at 01:30 pm.

Adjustment Number: 22A 023175,
Payable Number: 991092,
Receipt Number: 22RP009627,
Amount: $20.00
Court ordered Justice Point Pretrial Services LEVEL 1 SUPERVISION.  Court reminders.

Defendant Jammeell J Mckee Jr in court with attorney Sam Obscherning.  Defendant Jammeell J Mckee Jr in custody.  Emily S Zimmel appeared for the State of Wisconsin.  Jammeell J Mckee Jr appeared by video means with Attorney.  Defendant is advised this case is assigned to Judge Childs, Branch 02.  Defendant given a copy of the complaint and advised of maximum penalties, right to counsel and right to a preliminary hearing.  Court reviewed the complaint and found probable cause to hold defendant for further proceedings.  DEFENDANT IS INDIGENT AND PUBLIC DEFENDER WILL PROVIDE COUNSEL.  This hearing will be streamed live on Dacast:  https://iframe.dacast.com/live/4dafbf46-ed15-c11c-fa22-a58262833632/99073afd-37c2-acfa-830d-b1ddcaebf0ea  Preliminary hearing scheduled for March 24, 2022 at 01:30 pm.
Defendant in Custody, Court appearance today in Intake Court, Room 137A.
